resources.string: If you want AppAlarm to stop a custom intent or home screen shortcut, you must select which app your custom intent represents. If you ignore this message, the \"Force App Restart On Launch\" and \"Stop App On Dismiss/Timeout\" features will be disabled.

IMPORTANT: 
If you use a taskkiller, you must add AppAlarm to it's ignore list (or risk your alarms not going off). If AppAlarm is ever forced to close, make sure to re-open it to reschedule your alarms.
 
Android 2.2 (Froyo) removed the ability for AppAlarm to force other apps to stop. This means that if you use AppAlarm with Pandora or Slacker (or several other music apps) you HAVE TO REMEMBER TO EXIT THOSE APPS EVERY TIME YOU FINISH USING THEM. Otherwise AppAlarm will only be able to bring those apps to the foreground, but it will not be able to make the music start. Sorry but this is a limitation in Android and there is no fix in sight :( 

Android 2.1 and below should still work just fine.
 
You can now backup your alarms to your SD card. Just press the MENU button on your phone from the main alarm list.
 
AppAlarm Pro is now Free and Open Source! Code is available at https://github.com/ghackett/AppAlarm
Network test failed, playing backup alarm.
Wi-Fi connection failed, launching alarm anyway.
Wi-Fi connection failed, playing backup alarm.
The status bar notification is now OFF.
The status bar notification is now ON and will be displayed whenever an alarm is enabled.
Don\'t launch the alarm if the phone is off the hook (i.e. you\'re on a call).

Force the selected app to restart before launching it. This is helpful for Pandora and StreamFurious Pro users in case you left the app paused on last use. This is NOT recommended for Slacker Radio users.

Enabling this will unlock your phone when the alarm goes off and display the mute-snooze dialog. This allows you to snooze the alarm by muting the volume for a period of time. (You can still snooze the alarm from the notification bar when this is disabled)
Do not launch the app if the network test fails (you can also configure the backup alarm to play if the network test fails).
Change the media volume before launching the app.
Force the selected app to close when the alarm service times out. This feature is NOT recommended for Slacker users.
Turn off the Wi-Fi when the alarm service times out or is dismissed.
Turns on Wi-Fi before launching the alarm. The alarm service will wait for a successful connection before launching the alarm.
Enter a custom label for your alarm.
Press the \"Snooze\" button to mute the media volume. Otherwise press \"Dismiss\" to close this dialog and stop the alarm service and backup ringtone.
Press the \"Un-Snooze\" button to un-mute the media volume. Otherwise press \"Dismiss\" to close this dialog and stop the alarm service and cancel the snooze.
I\'ve found that the best way to test the network is to actually try and contact a web site. Enter a URL to try and connect to before launching the app.
If you experience problems with Pandora or Slacker not starting correctly, please try disabling this feature.
Choose how long to \"snooze\" the alarm.
Choose how long to wait for a Wi-Fi connection before declaring a Wi-Fi failure.
Choose how long to keep the alarm service running when the phone is on battery power. (NOTE: Clearing the notification icon will stop the alarm service and release the WakeLock)
Choose how long to keep the alarm service running when the phone is plugged in. (NOTE: Clearing the notification icon will stop the alarm service and release the WakeLock)
